description: In addition to the Wine 10.0 stable release today, making the day very exciting as well for Linux gamers is the first official SDL 3.0 release!..
title: SDL 3 Officially Released With New APIs, Better HiDPI & Improved Audio Handling

description: In addition to the Bcachefs changes for the Linux 6.14 kernel, the Btrfs file-system feature updates have also been submitted and merged for this next version of the Linux kernel...
title: Btrfs Changes Land In Linux 6.14 With New RAID1 Round-Robin Option

description: On the first day of the Linux 6.14 merge window there were a number of new AMD CPU features submitted. That's continued today with so far having the new "amd_node" driver to talk about for splitting up the modern Zen-era code and more of the legacy AMD Northbridge code from the pre-Zen days...
title: New "AMD Node" Driver Introduced In Linux 6.14 For Splitting Up Legacy Northbridge Code

description: As was expected this week, Wine 10.0 stable is now available as the newest annual feature release to this open-source software that allows running Windows games and applications on Linux and other platforms. Wine also serves as the basis for Valve's Steam Play (Proton) and CodeWeavers' CrossOver software...
title: Wine 10.0 Released With Native Wayland Support, Better HiDPI

description: Along with recently announcing the Raspberry Pi 500 keyboard computer and the Raspberry Pi 5 16GB (review still forthcoming; the 16GB model only arrived last week), the Raspberry Pi Monitor debuted last month as their first foray into displays. For $100 USD you get a 15.6-inch 1080p display that is simple but pairs well with the Raspberry Pi 400/500 or just the single board computer or any other HDMI-connected device for that matter.
title: Raspberry Pi Monitor Pairs Great With The Raspberry Pi 500 As A $100 Display

description: Serpent OS as the modern, from-scratch Linux distribution being led by well known open-source developer Ikey Doherty has started on a new project: disks-rs. The disks-rs project is intended to deal with file-systems, installation / partitioning, and block device management in a safe and effective manner from the Rust programming language...
title: Serpent OS Developing disks-rs To Safely Deal With File-Systems & Block Devices In Rust

description: Adding to the plethora of new hardware support coming with the Linux 6.14 kernel is enabling upstream support for the FPGAs found on the Intel-powered AAEON UP single board computers that are targeted for makers, hobbyists, and various industrial uses...
title: Linux 6.14 Landing Support For FPGA Support On AAEON UP Maker Boards

description: The big networking subsystem feature pull was sent out this morning for the Linux 6.14 merge window...
title: Linux 6.14 Networking Brings Many Wired & Wireless Driver Improvements

description: Over the past week there has been an uptick in patches pertaining to RDNA4's GFX12 graphics engine within the open-source Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" for Mesa 25.0 to benefit Linux systems...
title: Open-Source Radeon Vulkan Driver "RADV" Seeing More RDNA4 Work In Recent Days

description: Intel's upstreaming work around the next-gen Core Ultra "Panther Lake" processors continues for the Linux kernel. Among other code being prepped for submitting during the Linux 6.14 merge window, on Monday the thermal driver updates were focused on enabling support for Intel Panther Lake processors...
title: Linux 6.14 Thermal Drivers Get Ready For Intel Panther Lake

description: In addition to merging a number of the pull requests yesterday for the start of the Linux 6.14 cycle, Linux creator Linus Torvalds did merge some of his own new code as well. While his time these days working on new kernel code itself is more limited with managing the ever-growing upstream kernel community, he has managed some notable items in recent times like addressing ARM64 kernel annoyances and some performance optimizations...
title: Linus Torvalds Adapts Linux User Address Masking To Use CMOV

description: The x86/cache updates for the in-development Linux 6.14 kernel are extending the Resource Control "resctrl" code for Intel Resource Director Technology /  AMD Platform Quality of Service to have the capability of total memory bandwidth monitoring...
title: Linux 6.14 Resource Control To Allow Total Memory Bandwidth Monitoring

description: As a follow-up to yesterday's article around the on-disk format changes and other feature work on Bcachefs for Linux 6.14, the changes ended up being merged without issue for this next kernel version. That came after the Bcachefs changes were rejected during the Linux 6.13 cycle due to a Code of Conduct (CoC) committee decision...
title: Bcachefs Changes Merged Without Issue For The Linux 6.14 Kernel
